title: API Design for Library Authors
summary: A library is code distributed in such a way that strangers can use it. In this talk we consider:  1) why Python developers make bad libraries and poor APIs; 2) how to make your library API maximally useful for others; 3) examples of real-world antipatterns involving APIs.
